data.title: Excellent Accomodations
data.text: The is a very nicely furnished and comfortable B&B.  It is located next to the ECU campus and thus excellent for anyone visiting the campus.  All the rooms are upstairs and there is no elevator so this would not be suitable for someone unable to navigate the steps. The breakfast is good but could be better.

data.title: Best place in Greenville!
data.text: You can't beat the hospitality and the location. The Inn was clean, the owner very pleasant and informative but not overbearing the way some innkeepers can be. We stayed in 3rd floor chancellor room- very nice and private with bed, sitting room and bathroom. Breakfast was great and cookies at night in the kitchen. Location is across the street from ECU- perfect for us visiting the university. Great dinner within walking distance at Starlight Cafe. Would definitely come back here. Also very reasonably priced.

data.title: Terrific B&B!
data.text: Stayed here while in town for an ECU on-campus event.  Chris, innkeeper and owner, was a terrific host and very accommodating of our late arrival and need to leave our car parked there for most of the next day (even after we had checked out).  It felt more like staying with a family friend than a business.  Breakfast was top-notch, and the rooms were charming, in good condition, and very clean.  The complementary WiFi was robust and reliable.   It's also a GREAT VALUE: Since it seems that PRICE info is not directly reported by these owners, I'll go ahead and "reveal" that we paid:  We got "the Chancellor Suite" [top floor, HUGE, with a large sitting area and two TVs] for $129/night PLUS another room (on 2nd floor) which cost only $50/nt because we had booked more than one room.   In other words, if your traveling party needs more than one room, 5th St. offers a BIG discount on the 2nd (and 3rd ..4th, etc).. ]   So, bottom-line:  1st-Class, convenient accommodations with thoughtful and considerate management for just under $200 (2 rooms)-- that is VERY tough to beat.   We plan to stay nowhere else on future visits to Greenville.  :-)

data.title: Wonderful place to spend an evening in Greenville!
data.text: I recently traveled to Greenville on business and was pleasantly surprised to be accommodated in this lovely inn, instead of a hotel.  Chris, the owner, was very accommodating!  I was greeted in the nicely appointed room with a written greeting.  The bed was quite comfortable.  The bathroom, while not large, was clean and well-maintained.  There was even wine out for the guests to enjoy in the evening!  The street outside and the Inn was very quiet.  The only downside was that the flat screen TV is smaller than in most hotels and was not hi-def, but perfectly adequate.  The inn is immediately across the street from ECU and walking distance to some of the downtown area.  I would definitely stay here again!

data.title: Best lodging for anyone visiting ECU
data.text: The owner is a great guy, who is very concerned with making sure that his guests are comfortable.  Lovely rooms, great breakfast and across the street from the campus.  A great place to stay when visiting ECU.  You can't beat 5th Street Inn.

data.title: Mixed Bag
data.text:
We were in the Professor's Room, which was immaculate and comfortable, although the bathroom was about the size of a closet.  The house is well-maintained and well-located, with a comfortable, screened porch which we made good use of.    

The innkeeper seemed to be distracted, every time we had contact with him, although he did recommend an excellent restaurant for dinner.  Breakfast was pretty bad.  When we came downstairs in the morning, there was one other couple at the table.  No innkeeper visible, and no OJ left, no hot water for tea, and not much to eat.

data.title: A Gem in Greenville
data.text: What a wonderful bed and breakfast! The rooms were spacious and very clean, with lovely sheets and blankets.  Breakfast was delightful.  If you are traveling to Greenville It is is a fabulous place to stay.

data.title: great place great location!
data.text: i always look for b&b's as opposed to hotels so i was happy to find the 5th street inn which is located right across from the campus of ECU!  this exceptional b&b is the only one in historic greenville and a fine one it is! let me say that its against my better judgement to write this review because every time i go to make a reservation and there's no availability, i want cry. that said, it is as nice as any b&b i've ever stayed in. the rooms are beautifully furnished and comfortable as is the rest of the house. if you happen to be there in warmer weather, the screened porch is a great place to unwind after a long day running around the campus. the staff are welcoming and make sure we have everything we need to make ours an enjoyable stay, but not to the point of hovering. breakfasts are delicious and served in the elegantly appointed dining room. thought it is a 5 hour drive, i never mind doing the pick up and drop off if i know i can get a room at the inn!
